intro: Aneilema aequinoctiale var. kirkii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of foliage with a short, stout stem. Its flowers are usually pink, purple, or white, and they bloom in clusters at the top of the plant. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect light for optimal growth.
